Isn't Freedom just another word for nothing left to lose?
Freedom is just another word for Libre Graphics!
And nothin' ain't worth nothin' but it's free.
When you got nothin', you got nothin' to lose.
Nope. When thinking this, you might end up in oppression, as well.
There is freedom *FROM* and freedom *TO*.
No, freedom is another word for "you get to do what you choose."
When you have freedom you have something to lose.
This is fine for people in developing countries, but I can afford Photoshop. Why bother?
All this is not about money my friend, it is about freedom.
People in developing countries get Photoshop for free! Floss is not about money!
Freedom comes with a price as well!
Would you stop thinking about price for one fuckin' second, and consider ethics, too?
If i invent my own coin, will you pay for it?

Nobody wants you to give up Photoshop if you can afford it and are happy with it. In fact, many users of other apps will actually be happy if you stick to it instead of entering their community and bicker about "why $app is not more like Photoshop".
So now I will design for free too?
FREE like free speech and not like free beer!
Design for love, Work for money.
Only if you want to.
Freedom is not about price.
You will design IN FREEDOM, but the tools you use have no bearing on what you are able to charge for your designs. Free as in freedom, not as in price.
fOR FREEDOM!
If you want, your call.
What is this aptitude about?
About Fuck you!
Good question. What is this weird packaging system that goes on in the back of the os and only super users can config their computers?

Hello! I pasted here some information for you! It's from the text you get when putting 'man aptitude' into your command line: Description aptitude is a text-based interface to the Debian GNU/Linux package system. It allows the user to view the list of packages and to perform package management tasks such as installing, upgrading, and removing packages. Actions may be performed from a visual interface or from the command-line.
Does working with Free software mean using Free fonts too?
It might. There are lots of good ones. But you can also use the proprietary ones.
You do not have to, but why not?
Not if you don't want to. But there are enough free fonts on openfontlibrary and elsewhere to do just about anything

No. You are free to choose what you want to use. But what's the point on using free software and using non-free fonts? Free software is not about software any more, the whole point now is free culture.
If GNU/Linux would do black boxes like Apple, but in a proper way, wouldn't it take off more easily?
GNU/Linux is actually the most used operating systems, it runs on most servers, DVD players, etc. Still, most people don't know about those free black boxes. So I guess the answer is no.
Popularity and profits is always easier to achieve if you are willing to trade off some ethics.
Black boxes?
Why doesn't this work like I'm used to?
Remember switching from ironing to surfing. Both a board, different experiences.
Because not all flowers do have the same fragrances.
Remember the last time you said that.
The world changes. Sometimes for worse, sometimes for better.
Because they didn't set out to directly clone what you're used to.
Is this software for poor people?
It is for everybody!
For all of us.
Being precise, it's just the opposite. Poor people usually don't have enough time for taking the "risky way".
Obviously is for smart people, so... not poor at all.
No, 'poor' people do not this software at all, the only use Facebook and watch TV programs like Gran Hermano 14.
It is! I'm poor too!
Realistically, no, it isn't. It's for smart, creative, middle class people.
Is poor people made of free hardware?

Apparently not. There have been complaints that FLOSS is most accessible to comparativley well-off "first worlders" (with slogans like "FLOSS is made by the first world for the first world"). Poor people are sometimes restricited to using pirated and trojaned proprietary software, because their access to software is via other people who want to gain profits from their desperate need to be connected.
What is this command-line about?
The GNU/Linux commandline is a ludic interface, playful, user-generated and user-driven, flexible, low-cost and cooperative.
The commandline provides functions, not applications, methods, not solutions.
On the commandline the application can be built, and the solution invented, by users themselves.
sudo power
The command line allows us to finish our work faster and rest our hands on the keyboard at the same time.
It's magic!
$: man magic
cat menu | grep shrimp | test -lt $10
¿Necesito café para vivir mejor?
Isn't coffee just for academics?
Bruno Maag said designing the Ubuntu fonts by working closely with the Ubuntu community reminded him of being back in school. Will I be questioned about all my decisions, too?
No.
Maybe.
Yes.
Why do you keep using this software if it makes you cry using it?
Fortunately, it makes me laugh too.
I don't use any software, that would feel awkward to me.
Because someone else chose SAP R/3 over the spreadsheet that would be sufficient to replace it.
Because I use contact lens and thus, crying helps my eyes to get comfortable.
What do I do when I find a bug?
You can see if anyone else has found it and how they dealt with it. If not, then you can report a new bug and help the developers.
Let the developers know, and include instructions and a test-case if possible. Written almost 14 years ago, and still true today: http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/bugs.html
Document it to make it a feature!
Report it to the project's bug tracker system (probably easy to find on its website).
I cry!
But isn't Photoshop way more awesome than GIMP?
There's more than one way to do it!
Photoshop is commercial software and Gimp is free.
Photoshop is lacking hacking.
Unfortunately, tools often suffer from overdetermined functionality and are full of assumptions. You should be able to change these assumptions!
The best is the enemy of the good.
Isn't Gimp way more awesome than Photoshop? F*ck Yeah!
Yes ... I mean No!
No, really.
If you think it is, then help make GIMP awesome. Since it's free software, you really can. :)
True, but will not run natively on Linux, and not Free or Libre.
It's way more bloated, and doesn't respect your freedom. So, all things being equal, I'd say no.
Isn't this stuff just for people who have too much free time?

Yes. We should ban people from having free time - too many people are creating art, writing fiction, composing music, and generally doing the things they *love* during their free time. There is beauty in code, and programming can be just as much of an artistic expression as a sculpture or song.
There is no such thing as free time. There is just time left. Like copy left.
Who has free time, i'd like to buy some from them.
Define free-time first
Will this run on my PC?
Yes, and also in your toaster if you want.
Yes. If not, you can make it run on your PC, or pay someone to do it for you.
You need to use the Linux installer. Everything will work then.
Yes. Preferably, with that "PC" running GNU/Linux (PC =/= Windows computer).
Yes. A few apps are limited to certain operating systems, but the majority of it runs on all of them, and will even look and feel the same regardless of the platform.
Two of the most famous products of Berkeley are LSD and Unix. I don't think that this is a coincidence.
The sum of the parts is greater than the whole.
Me neither.
Innovative and Powerful!
Why is nobody ever talking about this at ATypI?
Designers like to think they are very creative but sometimes they can be very conservative about conforming to standard ideas of what is "professional".
They do actually. I do. Come to ATypI and talk about it too! :-)
Some do talk about this, but the conversations have to be carried out in secret, covert operations and stealth. Then one day, enough people are talking and the revolution is afoot...

Actually they do talk about this at ATypI. I know because I keep going to their meetings and I am even on the board. I even gave a talk about a Libre program TTFAutohint. :-) There is light. Keep going!
¿Que estas hablando?
They're afraid of being stigmatized as anti-profit hippies.
What is ATYPI?
Photoshop already works for me. Why should I use something else?
How long does it takes to generate a PDF via Scribus?
It's a nice tool but it doesn't fulfil all the bitmap workflow. And you need a free and easy to grab alternative.
Cause photoshop doesn't listen to you if you don't pay them.
Because you are smart and understand that each tool embodies the particular world views of its authors. The more tools you use the more you free your practice from outside constraints.
I'm not trying to convert anyone. If it works for you keep it.
Because freedom > convenience.
Cambiar es revolucionario.
I'm tired
When sleep mode was first introduced it was usually not tested.
I need sleep too.
Yo con hambre y sed.
clntudp_create: out of memory.
From a famous print graphic designer: Why can you design a webpage by editing the source code and not do the same for print design?
Some print designers publish the source files they used to create their work, in which case you can do this. Some people call this "Open Design".
Because no-libre software doesn't allow you to do that.
The Print doesn't support it self on source-code, since its physical.
You can. It's called Postscript.
You can. BTDT, in PCL, because it was the easiest way to add the necessary commands directly into a text file with a text editor in order to get the print just right.
Will my .indd files open in Scribus?
What is an .indd file?
Are you sure In-Design will open your .indd files after the next upgrade cycle?
Nope.
Why do these programs all look different?
Why do all people look different?
Let's see for ourselves.
Because they were designed by diverse teams of people, instead of imposed from above by one conglomorate calle Adobe. Duh.
skdhaksdhkasdh....Mi no entender nada
Who do I call when the software breaks?
You can hire any programmer of your choice, because everybody has the right to access and modify the source code of Free/Libre/Open Source software.
Try google. Often other people have had the same issues and found and posted solutions or workarounds. If it is not the case, file a bug at the project bugtracker.
You bug report it on the project's bug tracker website, and it may get fixed soon.
God
Will it break my computer?
¿SE COMERÁ EL RESTO DE MI MANZANA?
They did make it unusable, noone is born an operating systems connaisseur, its like a game! So yeah, it will break your mind to configurate it to the right state.
It will break your mind!
If by saying break you mean break free... ask Queen!
Will this run on my Mac?
Many FOSS tools also run on OS X. Ubuntu will also run on mac hardware.
Ask Apple CEOs If you got a written note from Steve. stockholders if they will let loose the leash on engineers to bring Apple back to the reason why it was founded. THOUGH THIS WILL NEVER HAPPEN!
yaay

The most popular libre graphics tools will run like a normal Mac app, yes. If the one you are interested in does not, it might run with 'X11,' a unix compatibility tool; and you can run a GNU+Linux system on your Mac desktop with the libre Virtual Box tool, which is convenient but may be slow. If you need speed, you can install GNU+Linux directly and reboot into it when you need to.
You should totally switch to GNU/Linux, though.
If I can use the command-line, why use a graphical interface?
Don't. Use what you're most comfortable with. Celebrate the fact you have a choice.
physical connection - spatial relationship

If you like command line, then stick to it. On my side it is way easier too teach something visual like a grapical interface than to teach people to remember command lines. it is a question of intuitivity.
The developers have to eat. How do people earn money writing Libre Graphics applications?
Click here to make a donation.
Most of them are paid by companies, others work in their free time.

They will be heros Some of the developers actually get paid. Others do it on the side. Somehow, it works. called everywhere Users can pay the developers! When you love your tools and you own the tools it's just common sense that you feel enticed to contribute for their improvement. be payed awesome fees to make it work!
They get payed, obviously.
¿Por qué pensamos que lo gratis es indefectiblemente de mala calidad?
porque estamos dominados por prejuicios
Will my .sla files open in InDesign?
Nope. But why is this important?
I read that Scribus/Inkscape don't have support for Pantone, does that mean I need to work in black and white?
Free is the new black!
Panettone is delicious with a little butter but color management is not a big problem in scribus and inkscape.
No, black and white also are owned by Pantone®
Only if you want to. Pantone owns the name for some pigment mixes used at print shops. They don't own colour.
How long does it takes to generate a PDF via Scribus?
Rome wasn't built in a day.
How long is a metre pole?
Bah! 3 clicks!
Um, a few seconds.
Isn't Libre Graphics just for PROS?
It's there for everyone!
It's for anyone.
My company needs proprietary software to get a competitive edge.

Software is not just a way to get a job done but they constitute a vital part of your creative practice. You should have the right to study how the program works, and change it to make it do what you wish.

We like to think that our society encourages helping your neighbor; but each time we reward someone for obstructionism, or admire them for the wealth they have gained in this way, we are sending the opposite message.
You can make a difference using Libre Graphics
If you need secrets in order to be competitive, then maybe your company doesn't really provide your customers with what they need?
Does it make sense to use GNU/Linux if my hardware is proprietary?
Does it make sense to do not my left hand if I have cut my right hand?
Your hardware isn't "proprietary" in the same sense as the software that runs on it. If you know what you're doing, nobody is stopping you from tinkering with your hardware.
It does. We are working on libre hardware designs as well. Don't worry, we will get there eventually. Human life is about transitions; we evolve.
GNU/Linux supports more proprietary hardware than Windows or any other OS.
How you can I work and make better the world?
USE FREE SOFTWARE!
¡Y trabajar de manera colaborativa!
make: *** No rule to make target `love'. Stop.
Does Free software look too ugly for designers?
Beauty is in the eye of the beholder.
Things which hurt, instruct!
Yes.
Ugly is the new beautiful.
A hammer needs to be beautiful?
No, in most cases they simply weren't aware of it to begin with.
Designers think most things look ugly...
Shouldn't I rather spend my time on doing really good design?
Shouldn't you spend your time away from the keyboard?
Rather than?
Shouldn't you stop asking dumb questions?
¿No deberías leer más?
Aren't Libre tools just cheaper copies of Adobe?
They are actually copies of Quark and Fractal Design Painter.
And both are copies of a pencil and a paper.
No. If you want a cheaper copy go to the black market. If you want a viable option go Libre.
Adobe is a more expensive version of Macromedia, no they are not copies of ad-rob-me, they are alternatives to the status quo.
Isn't Adobe stuff just overly engineered copies of Ivan Sutherland's Sketchpad?
Yes, but more unusable.
They're not copies. They're independent projects meant to do the same kind of work, that actually respect your freedom.
Some too-cheap-to-buy-Adobe-users would like them to be copies, but unfortunately they tend go their own directions.
No, they are high-quality tools with their own identity that conform to a different set of ideals and have different uses. Some uses may overlap, but they are not clones.
Why are there so many GNU/Linux distributions? How do you choose one of them?
Choose life.
Choose one if it doesn't work. Choose another one to get the best one you need to try.
Personally, I read about it, hear about it, maybe watch a video about it. And I ask about it, as well. What would be the best way to find out about the distribution you would want to use?

Here's a thought: start with the ten most popular one on DistroWatch, do a little casual comparison, and settle on what seems most interesting to you. As a designer, probably nothing will suit you better than the Fedora Design Suite (a "spin" of Fedora).
There are so many GNU/Linux distributions because nobody is preventing you from taking the code and making your own.
Will I turn into a geek when I use Libre Graphics?
Probably, depends on your definition of a geek.
Yes but it's ok. Chicks dig it.
You're one already asking that question.
Is that such a bad thing, anyway?
Why is this button not where I expect it?
It's on the upper left corner.
You're wearing a t-shirt, not a shirt.
You can contribute: choose it's place.
Won't people steal my work if I release it under a permissive license?
Perhaps, but it depends on what you'd intended for it - if you're not too tight on its context and you'd like it to be seen by a load of people then it can sometimes be a good idea.
A good permissive license will prevent any possible theft by making it legal.

Don't you want your work shared with the world? Isn't it good when someone likes your work enough to make a derivative work? And if you choose CC-by or CC-by-sa, then all derivates must mention your work and your name.
If u really want to share something, you have to let it free so others can improve your work and play with your amazing piece of art.
I asked about Libre Graphics on the mailinglist. Why did nobody answer?
They forgot to tell you about http://libregraphicsproduction.com/.
No tiene ganas de responder nada
If I care about my tools, will it make me less creative?
Tools become a part of you.
Your tools will more closely adapt to your creativity instead...
Not if you make your tools, too.
If you sharpen your drawing pencil, will that make you less creative?
Maybe when just starting out. But eventually the tools just become an extension of you, and your creativity's on full blast. :)
That would be werid.
Isn't Libre Graphics just for amateurs?
(French amateur "lover of", from Old French and ultimately from Latin amatorem nom. amator, "lover") -- Wikipedia contributors, "Amateur"
Lejos de consederarme amateur, consediro la Gráfica Libre una nueva perspectiva donde enfocar todos mis trabajos y darles sentido.
Libre fonts are incomplete, otherwise they'd be for sale, right?
No.
They are as good, made with love and care.
Lies, misinformation and too little googling.
At some level, all fonts are incomplete. The potential of libre fonts is unlimited, while the potential of non-libre fonts is limited by the proprietor.
No, they are fonts that the font designer decided to contribute to society. Quality varies from poor to outstanding.
As a typographer, sometimes i just release some weights of the font but not the entire family. So no, sometimes they're really a professional work.
Can I use free and open source software and keep what I produce with it for myself?
Yes - the people that made your pen don't own the drawings that you do, and neither do the people that made your software.
Yes, the tools and the output from the tools are separate works.
You can release your productions under whatever terms you wish.
Can you tell from the final design that it was made by free software? If not, what's the point?
If you want to show off then add a little text that says "made with FLOSS" otherwise you might want to consider weather declaring your tool of choice is part of the message you want to communicate.
To have fast and powerful tools available everywhere.
The final design is up to your ability to execute your vision.
Ideally, no, you can't. The point is that you were a part of the better, more ethical social system. The Free one. Not just the convenient one.
You usually can, because it does not add a "Created by Photoshop CS6 licensed to CmDrKeEn, Serial-Nr ADB334455" to all of your files.
Why do they not teach Libre graphics at school?
I do teach them at the university.
They are busy teaching religion.
Good question. Ask your Teachers!

Schools teach what industry uses. Industry uses what school grads know. Like drug pushers, commercial software vendors give expensive products cheap to schools and students so they will only know commercial products when they go into industry, and industry must buy their expensive software. Go, capitalism!
Because they are Adobe's bitch.
They do. They even complain occasionally if we change something and they have to change their course material.
Will using Free Software make me look less professional?
That depends on your definition of professional!
Bad designs will make you less professional. If you care about tools and not about design you will not be a great designer.
No. See http://libregraphicsproduction.com/.
The quill pens used by Leonardo were not made by Adobe, so his works weren't really professional?

No, not knowing what you're doing with the software will make you look less professional. And if your employers or superiors are aware that you don't use the proprietary "industry standard", they might even respect you more for being a risk-taker.
Sólo si lo eres.
If you're incompetent, yes.
Isn't this going to blow over soon?
Free software has existed in some form as long as there have been programmers. Proprietary software programs, on the other hand, tend to die out after a few years.
Or the contrary.
This year (2013) will see the 30th anniversary of the GNU Project, possibly the most well known name in the Free Software world. Free Software is showing no signs of stopping, or even slowing down.
30th Century Tux An Off World Colony
Adobe would like that!
No, it's been an official movement since the 80s. And it's grown exponentially.
DOSSIER DE PRENSA PRESS KIT
10-13 ABRIL
DISEÑO GRÁFICO LIBRE
NUEVAS HERRAMIENTAS CREATIVAS
INVENTAR HERRAMIENTAS DEL FUTURO
8º EDICIÓN INTERNACIONAL EN MEDIALAB-PRADO
TALLER INTERACTIVOS?'13 HERRAMIENTAS PARA UN MUNDO LEGIBLE Y EDITABLE (15-27 ABRIL)
Do I need to learn to program if I want Libre graphics?
That's whats so cool, you don't but you'd wanna......
Nope.
Absolutely not. Most users of libre software never touch the source code.
No. but you can. And it doesn't stop at using a macro API if you need more...
What is this LGRU?
It's the Libre Graphics Research Unit!
If I want to contribute to Libre Graphics, do I need to code?
No. There are a lot of possibilities to get involved.
No, you can give feedback to the programmers, make tutorials, share your experiences...
No. You could write documentation. You could test and report the bugs. You could simply help people out on the forums or IRC chat.
You can even contribute money to pay a programer, or fundraise for a project.
Isn't free software for academics?
Yes, and everyone else.
Isn't freedom for academics?

Empower individuals and communities to create their own money. All money in Ripple is explicitly represented as debt, with transactions simply consisting of balances being shifted on a series of imaginary credit lines from the payer to the receiver. In order to explain how this works in practice, consider a simple example. Suppose there are two friends, B and C, taking a road trip, and they both decided to bring along a friend of their own; B brought his friend A and C brought his friend D. A knows B, but has never met C and D before and they may well never meet again, and similarly D has never met A and B. Now, suppose that A and D are out getting a coffee, but D does not have money to pay.
Yes. And everyone else, too.
Please expand on the scenario about A,B, C,D, is this about ethics about A paying for D?
If Google, Facebook, Twitter, Oracle, and Amazon are academics, then yes. If not, then free software is some of the best software you could ever use.
Will I be able to be equally productive?
Yes, see http://libregraphicsproduction.com/.
Once you get used to the software, of course you will.
Why do you teach us open source tools?
Somebody has to do it ;)
Because I believe in them!
Do you pay every time you eat fish, or have you already learnt how to use a fishing pole? Have you built one? Cool, let's share designs Because they give freedom to whom use them. improve together.
So you can adapt easily.
Because it's the right thing to do.
For me, it's like teaching religion without give the freedom of choice. If i just teach Adobe, what happens to the free tools? Why not teach both of them and let the students choose their own path?
Does Libre Graphics mean the same as Open Design?
Hopefully could be a great idea, unfortunately at the moment the system that are running can't afford to lost money because of the open source.
Open design is an ideal, libre graphics is a workflow.
They are two things that go hand in hand.
Libre -- why use such a fancy foreign term?
Ce n'est pas 'fancy', ni 'foreign' à moi!
Because "free" can mean more than one thing: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gratis_versus_libre
Universal word and concept.
Oh, wait! This entire sentence is in a foreign language, except that word :)
Because there is no unambiguous word in the English language that means free "as in freedom." If you say free software, people will probably only think of price.
Will it run on my iPhone?
Potentially. Wanna port it?
Probably not, because Apple designed the iPhone developer license terms to be incompatible with FLOSS.
Do I now have to buy a black Thinkpad too?
Black thinkpads are astonishingly resistant and compatible and cheap when secondhand. And the red little joystick in the keyboard worth a try.
I know it's boring. Take an old tower PC and stick in in an old wine crate and put it under your desk.
No. You can use Free software on a brushed metal MacBook.
Only if you want to look trendy and cool.
lol (not)
Of course!
Yes. There are also cookies.
My clients don't pay for this, do they?
Or: isn't this a way to escape from the short term product-delivery mindset and turn your clients into collaborators?
They pay for my skills.
Yes, they must pay double for unsupported things.
Speak to the developers.
They're paying for your time to ask those questions, so they probably aren't too picky.
Which famous designers use open source software?
Ben Fry.
Me, though I'm UN-famous.
Me too!
How can you be busy with free software when there are still people going hungry?
How can you watch films if we still have no cure for cancer?

Because through writing free software, you are changing the social You think all our efforts are altruistic, just to create a better world? We like to think so, too. Our brain invents this lie for us, to prevent us from discovering our true motivations, which are not quite as noble. I am very sorry to disappoint you, but we are only human. economic structure of the world, and in the end, those people will be hungry no more.
Ok, ill give the guy who lives under my stairs some vegan burgers, i hope he likes it........
Because you've got to choose your battles in life. I absolutely support efforts to alleviate hunger, and who says one person can't contribute to both causes?
What do you mean Free?
In what manner are you using the word "free"? http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gratis_versus_libre
Free as in freedom.
Open.
Free to use for any purpose you want. Free to share with other people. Free to modify. Free to share you modifications.
Free as in speech.
Yo te ayudo y tú me ayudas.
Haven't these people ever looked at usability?
Have you ever considered to learn another usability?
Do you want to help improve it?
What's not usable, moving from win-dust to OS X has a curve, same thing this way round.
Fake it till you make it.
Some did, some didn't.
Free software is a docracy, so if you are the expert in usability step forward and make it better.
Yes, they have. Don't confuse usability with the software having an interface you haven't gotten used to yet.
Either way, it's your chance to make a difference!
I read that Scribus/Inkscape don't have support for Pantone, does that mean I can't do stuff with Pantone colors?
I don't understand.
Yeah...
No, scribus does support pantone spot colors. Gimp does not yet, it can be possible in inkscape if you know to write xml.... I have used scribus for pantone spot colors before...
You can still play with them.
Can I ever go back?
Just press Ctrl Z.
Back to the Future?
The only way is up!
Be warned : you'll can, but you'll not want.
You will not want to.
Feel free.
No. You have already been assimilated.
Probably not. Going all-proprietary in this world means giving up lots of everyday technology.
Does Scribus have support for Pantone?
Does Pantone support Scribus?
Yes.

Who cares, Pantone definitions are not libre. Just don't use it and don't ask for it. Use what's available or help develope a libre Pantone. If Scribus supports Pantone, libre graphics is not really about libre graphics.
Why are there so little female developers?
Because not enough efforts are made (yet) to welcome them!
Good question. Help us with this please!
They get frightened.
They get intimidated, it's hard to develop in a strict language, they are waiting the next version of lisp-ada which will produce any program from a dialog with the computer.
Because hackers and coders use rude/inapropriate/discriminatory language and expressions, behaving often as in a adolescent group of boys.
Why are there so few female car mechanics? Same problem.
This place is too crowded with men, I guess.

It would help tremendously if more women would stop asking this question; stop asking for permission to participate, stop asking for approval. If you want to hack on something, go out and hack. You are a free woman.
The same reason there are so many more male geeks than females. Biology and society.
Maybe because of events like those in this list: http://geekfeminism.wikia.com/wiki/Timeline_of_incidents
How will my designs change with this?
As much as you want or need them to change.
Creo que no va cambiar nada.
Your designs will not change.
No debería porque...
How can I make time for this if I need to take care of my children too?
By kicking out proprietary software. Involving your children in free software.
You make time for everything, esp for your kids.
Teach them how to code.

It doesn't necessarily take much more extra time than the proprietary ones. Just download it instead of buying a proprietary app from a sotore, and use the thing. If you have any extra time, you might even file a bug report.
Any seriously used application will take the same amount of time to learn and use. It's just sad that nowadays, reading the user manual already makes you an expert compared to the average user.
Why do they call me an end-user?
I am not the end!
You at the other end of the computer.
Because you need to contribute to grow with the world.
Because you end up using stuff.
Because you're on the user end of the transaction.
¿LO LIBRE ES GRATIS?
¡la libertad no tiene precio!
My tools are just tools, what's the fuzz?
Tools aren't neutral and functional items but cultural items tools. They embody ideas, approches, ways of doing, methodologies... They carry and transmist their history, their genealogy.
It's not life or death, but it's better to support ethical, free, open tools to do the same stuff.
¿DEJARÁ DE PICARME EL KERNING?
Con saliva y paciencia
No lo sabes
Jamás.
How much is it?
It's free like the wind, but it will cost some of your precious time.
It's more than much, cause freedom has no price.
five
Just a ¨Thanks¨!
You do not pay for it at first until you want to start paying for it.
The price of freedom is always dear, but there's no substitute.
No money (unless you want to donate), but a firm commitment to freedom and community on your part.
A tee!
What you want to pay for it. You can also sell it for any price, even on Ebay.
Call me wind because I am absolutely blown away.
Call me wind beucase I am absolutely blown away.
ok, you're a fart.
Why is there so many different licenses? How do I choose one?
You should choose the one that fits your purpose.
See http://creativecommons.org/choose/ and http://www.gnu.org/licenses/license-recommendations.html.
Choose the right one!
Use the WTFPL -> http://www.wtfpl.net
Elige tu propio camino, elige elegir.
Will my clients still trust me?
As long as you do good work and deliver on time, absolutely.
As long as you do good work and deliver on time, absolutely. [2]
Usually, your clients want a finished product. They don't care about the tools you use.
I'm a developer. Why would I want to collaborate with designers?
Designers and developers need each other in order to produce software that is beautiful and functional.
If you are not the targeted user yourself, better to get to know some!
Designer have a great way to communicate your inner idea.
Because you can have the tools that make the world more easy and beautiful.
Because you guys were meant to work together.
How long does it takes to generate a PDF via Scribus?
It's just a mouse click away!
Never tried but for sure the same time or even less.
Depends on your document. Fast enough for me.
Isn't this just for poor people?
I would use this amazing software, if it wasn't so cheap.
Isn't freedom just for poor people?
That depends ... is wearing handcuffs only for rich people?
It's ethic just for rich people who can afford?
Do I need to learn everything again?
If you only learnt how to use the tools and not the basis, yes, you need to learn everything again.
Cool!
Just the things you really learned, everything else will be just new stuff.
Only the UI, same functions, most of the time...
Just some things. The user interface will not be exactly the same, but you will get used to it in no time.
Learn everything about what again?
You are never done learning.
Free means worse, right?
Just the opposite.
Free means free. Sometimes as in zero cost, sometimes as in freedom.
Are you a dictator?
No. It means free.
sure, that's why the air is so bad to you... please, stop breathing.
Will it be fun?
Depends on your definition of fun!
It already is :-)
I really need to sleep now!
How cannot! We have paper, just bring some pencils!
I'm a designer. Why would I want to collaborate with developers?
Because you're not a developer. Developers need graphic designers, as graphic designers need copywriters, as copywriters need illustrators, as illustrators need a pen.
If you pay a developer to collaborate with you, will be amazed at how far your ideas can be pushed.
Because they make the tools you use right now. The tools you love and hate. Or perhaps the tools you have envisioned in your mind. Dreamt about.
men, you dunno what your talking about...
